summary: This bill, the "Amateur Radio Emergency Preparedness Act," aims to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to preempt private land use restrictions that hinder amateur radio operators from installing and maintaining antennas. It seeks to ensure amateur radio operators can effectively utilize their stations, recognizing their role in emergency communications. The bill outlines permissible restrictions (like those related to safety and zoning) and limitations on prior approval requirements. The FCC is mandated to issue implementing regulations within 180 days.
